items.content:
920: :label: axiom-qsd-log-concave
921: 
922: **Historical Status (Pre-October 2025)**: Axiom (foundational assumption)
923: 
924: **Current Status (October 2025)**: ✅ **PROVEN THEOREM** - See [../2_geometric_gas/15_geometric_gas_lsi_proof.md](../2_geometric_gas/15_geometric_gas_lsi_proof.md)
925:

927: 
928: ---
929: 
930: **Original Axiom Statement** (retained for context):
931: 
932: Let $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}}(\tau) \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ be the full Markov operator for the N-particle Euclidean Gas. Let $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ be the unique quasi-stationary distribution of this process on the state space $\mathcal{S}_N = (\mathbb{R}^d \times \mathbb{R}^d)^N$.
933: 
934: We assume that $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ is a **log-concave** probability measure. That is, for any two swarm states $S_1, S_2 \in \mathcal{S}_N$ and any $\lambda \in (0,1)$:
935: 
936: $$
937: \pi_{\text{QSD}}(\lambda S_1 + (1-\lambda) S_2) \geq \pi_{\text{QSD}}(S_1)^\lambda \cdot \pi_{\text{QSD}}(S_2)^{1-\lambda}
938: $$
939: 
940: Equivalently, the density $p_{\text{QSD}}(S)$ (with respect to Lebesgue measure) has the form:
941: 
942: $$
943: p_{\text{QSD}}(S) = \exp(-V_{\text{QSD}}(S))
944: $$

items.label: axiom-confining-complete
items.title: Confining Potential (Complete Statement)
items.content:
5195: :label: axiom-confining-complete
5196: 
5197: The potential $U: \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}} \to \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$ satisfies:
5198: 
5199: 1. **Smoothness**: $U \in C^2(\mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}})$
5200: 2. **Non-negativity**: $U(x) \geq 0$ for all $x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}$
5201: 3. **Interior flatness**: There exists $R_{\text{safe}} > 0$ such that $U(x) = 0$ for $|x| < R_{\text{safe}}$
5202: 4. **Boundary growth**: For $|x| \geq R_{\text{safe}}$:
5203: 
5204: $$
5205: U(x) \geq C_U (|x| - R_{\text{safe}})^p
5206: $$
5207: 
5208: for some $C_U > 0$ and $p \geq 2$
5209: 
5210: 5. **Coercivity**: There exist $\alpha_U > 0$ and $R_0 \geq R_{\text{safe}}$ such that:
5211: 
5212: $$
